field.name: resourceType
field.definition: The educational type of the resource with regards to how the resource may be used in the classroom, professional development or in an informal educational setting.
The educational type of the resource with regards to how the resource may be used in the classroom, professional development or in an informal educational setting

value.definition: An audio recording of a book in print
The audio component (only) of a broadcast that was captured digitally from the web (e.g. newscast, speech, interviews)
An audio recording of a speech or classroom instruction
A recording of vocal, instrumental or mechanical sounds having rhythm, melody or harmony
Recorded historical information obtained in interviews concerning personal experiences and recollections
A recording of a newscast, talk show or other oral presentation originally generated via the radio
Recorded auditory material (e.g. natural world, mechanical, noise, tones)
Data measurements generated when the measuring instrument and the medium to be measured are in direct contact
Data generated by equations, computer models and numerical simulations
Data measurements generated when the measuring instrument and the medium to be measured are not in direct contact

Materials that are designed to measure student learning (exams, questionnaires, quizzes) or to support teacher design or development of such materials (rubrics). Materials that support existing assessments (answer keys). Materials that relate to the philosophy of assessment (articles about performance and authentic assessment, for example)
An intensive analysis of an individual unit (as a person or community) stressing developmental factors in relation to environment or a scientific study of a specific location or region

Defined as a classroom-based task or exercise that students are asked to do, often as part of a lesson plan or other larger unit of instruction-to help them develop particular skills, knowledge, or habits of mind. Usually, the goals and outcomes are broad.

Defined as a computer-based task or exercise that students are asked to do, often as part of a lesson plan or other larger unit of instruction-to help them develop particular skills, knowledge, or habits of mind. Usually, the goals and outcomes are broad. (e.g. Mountain Simulation: Assignment)

Defined as a sequence of instructional units done over a semester or quarter that are designed by teachers, faculty, or a group of instructors to significantly advance student skills, knowledge, and habits of mind in a particular discipline and to help students meet specified requirements as set forth in a curricula or district or state policy (e.g. Air Quality Meteorology)

Defined as a program of study. Examples include academic standards, (the knowledge, skills and habits of mind students are expected to acquire in particular grade levels or clusters of grade levels) and the units of instruction, often with sample lesson plans, illustrative student activities, and essential and supplementary resources that can help students reach standards. Curriculums are often designed at the state or school district level, but can also apply to a program of study required for a particular university or college-issued degree.

Defined as a field-based task or exercise that students are asked to do, often as part of a lesson plan or other larger unit of instruction-to help them develop particular or habits of mind. Usually, the goals and outcomes are broad.
Directions or suggestions for learning experiences outside of the classroom, usually off-site, either in general or specific to a particular location
Supporting material for teachers regarding the use of learning materials with respect to learning objectives, classroom management, materials, assessment, and additional reference material.

Defined as a laboratory-based task or exercise that students are asked to do, often as part of a lesson plan or other larger unit of instruction-to help them develop particular skills, knowledge, or habits of mind. Usually, the goals and outcomes are broad.

Defined as a plan for helping students learn a particular set of skills, knowledge or habits of mind; often includes student activities as well as teaching ideas, instructional materials, and other resources; is shorter in duration than and often a part of a unit or module
Defined as a sequence of lesson plans designed to teach a set of skills, knowledge and habits of mind (e.g. Oceanography)
A formal representation of ideas that is illustrated to others either visually or by the act of doing (e.g. PowerPoint slides)
A series of tasks or questions posed to the student, as in a homework or other assignment
Activities organized around a particular academic topic where goals and outcomes are generally broad in nature and interactions with other classrooms via the Internet may be a component.
General material describing a course or unit of study, includes outlines and table of contents
A resource that provides guided, practical information about a specific subject
A series of on-line visual and text-based resources that mimic the field trip experience in an electronic setting
A reference to a non-web-based entity like a book, CD-ROM or rock sample
Generally those URLs that include .com or .biz as part of the website address
Generally those URLs that include .edu or .musuem as part of the website address (e.g. University of California, Berkeley: Museum of Paleontology)
Generally those URLs that include .gov as part of the website address (e.g. National Climatic Data Center)
Generally URLs that include .org or .museum as part of the website address
A site where one can submit questions for personal response to either an individual or group of people who have specific expertise in the area of interest
A site that offers links to other sites organized around a topic or topics. The linked sites are hosted by unrelated organizations. (e.g. teachearth.com)
An interface where a group of individuals can engage in text-based talk about a particular subject; may or may not be synchronous
Email based communications that is usually topic-focused and distributed to a member-based group of individuals via a single email address
Interface whereby individuals can post information, requests or ideas for view by others
Mechanism by which the Internet or some sub-component, but more extensive than 'Search this Site', is searched based on a specific query entered by the user
A condensed version of a larger piece of work, outlining the major points and conclusions
A long written composition (includes literature, technical documentation and guides, excluding field and instructor guides)
A collection of specialized terms and their meanings

A list (as of bibliographical information or citations to a body of literature) arranged usually in alphabetical order of some specified datum (as author, subject, or keyword); a list often with descriptive or critical notes of writings relating to a particular subject, period, or author; a list of works written by an author or printed by a publishing house; the works or a list of the works referred to in a text or consulted by the author in its production.
Writings that appear in a periodical publication, often peer-reviewed and of an academic nature, sharing ideas or research results
A publication that is produced on some predictable schedule, such as weekly, monthly or annually
A document containing statements or series of steps for particular way of accomplishing things
A collection or papers or abstracts presented at a specific meeting or event
A formal document that outlines a specific project, recommendation, plan or idea

A work containing useful facts or information (e.g. user's guides, technical manuals). A student might consult this during independent research. It does not have a guided component. It may comprise hyperlinked pages but a specific path through it is not designated.
Detailed account or statement, often outlining the results or events of a meeting, endeavor, activity or study (e.g. review, evaluation)
Scholarly work for an academic degree
An appropriate value for the field has yet to be determined
A tool for mathematical conversions or calculations (e.g. metric to English, satellite tracker)
Allows for the enhancement of the resource; it generally does not stand alone (e.g. numerical models, applets, computer code)

Allows access, interactions with or the ability to execute resources; it does not enhance another piece of software rather it stands alone, (e.g. tools to look at and analyze data or create learning materials)
Visuals not generated from data and not meant to illustrate a scientific concept or process (e.g. artistic drawing, animations, clip art, virtual tours)

2-D representations of a single point in time or space that illustrate fairly static physical features (e.g. topos, soil, road, bedrock maps, etc.). For weather or forecast maps, use scientific visualization.
An image that has been taken with a camera and is available either online or offline
Imagery generated from measuring devices that are not in direct contact with the medium they are measuring (e.g. radar or satellite imagery)
Still or animated images not based on data but meant to illustrate scientific concepts or processes such as diagrams, graphs, figures or virtual reality (e.g. The Wilson Cycle)

Visuals generated from data or model output like graphed or modeled, dynamic or static, or physical or numerical data, simulations, animations, weather forecast maps or streamflow maps (e.g. Idealized ENSO Simulation)
Animated images for use on a computer or television screen (e.g. clips, interviews, lectures, movies, etc.)
A digital broadcast presented on or captured from the Internet (may include aduio)
